name: Cell-line-recognition
tagline: Cell line recognition and normalization system, supporting corpora and tagged documents.
body:
### Welcome to Turku cell line name recognition and normalization
The project is a result of collaboration between university of Turku, Gent university and Textimi. The aim of the project is to create corpus that is suitable for machine learning system to recognize establish cell line names from text. The recognized cell line names are normalized linking the names to Cellosaurus identifier. 

### Gellus and CLL Corpora
We created two manually annotated corpora, Gellus and CELL. Gellus is suitable for the training any machine learning system in recognizing cell line name mentions. CLL is suitable for evaluating the system in recognizing the Cellosaurus cell line names.

Gellus: (Download link)
CLL: (Download link)

### NERsuite model and corpora
We used NERsuite as our machine learning system trained on Gellus corpus supplemented with cell line name dictionary. In addition, we provide the derived corpora we used in our studies for those who want to train their system with alternative choices.

NERsuite model: (Download link)
dictionary: (Download link)
Gellus corpus split: (Download link)
JNPBA-CL corpus split: (Download link)
CellFinder-CL corpus split: (Download link)
  
### Tagged and normalized cell line name documents
We tagged and normalized cell line names in ~6.7 abstracts + full-text documents in EVEX database. About 500,000 documents contain at least 1 cell line name. We provided the documents with at least one cell line name tagged in standoff format.

Tagged document: (Download link)

### Authors and Contributors
Suwisa Kaewphan, Turku Center for Computer Science (TUCS)
Sofie Van Landeghem, Gent university
Tomoko Ohta, Textimi
Yves Van de Peer, Gent university
Filip Ginter, University of Turku
Sampo Pyysalo, University of Turku 

### Support or Contact
Please contact sukaew@utu.fi for further information or questions.
